intro: Belotia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and is often found near streams or in humid understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Belotia panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
